name: UpdateItemPositionParent
description:
Update an item's position or parent on a Miro board.

Use this tool to update the position or change the parent of an item on a Miro board. This requires the 'boards:write' scope and adheres to level 2 rate limiting.

parameters.name: board_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the board where the item's position or parent will be updated.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the board where you want to update the item.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item to update on the board.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the item that you want to update.

parameters.name: parent_frame_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the parent frame for the specified item.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the parent frame for the item.

parameters.name: item_x_axis_coordinate
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for the item's location on the board. Default is 0, with positioning relative to the board center.

value_schema.description:
X-axis coordinate of the location of the item on the board.
By default, all items have absolute positioning to the board, not the current viewport. Default: `0`.
The center point of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0` coordinates.

parameters.name: y_axis_coordinate
parameters.description: Y-axis coordinate for the item's location on the board. Defaults to `0` with absolute positioning to the board, not the viewport.

value_schema.description:
Y-axis coordinate of the location of the item on the board.
By default, all items have absolute positioning to the board, not the current viewport. Default: `0`.
The center point of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0` coordinates.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the miro API.

parameters.name: position.x

X-axis coordinate of the location of the item on the board.
By default, all items have absolute positioning to the board, not the current viewport. Default: `0`.
The center point of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0` coordinates.
